2. Evil Twin Attacks: An attacker can create a fake Wi-Fi network with the same name as a legitimate network to trick users into connecting to it. Once connected, the attacker can capture data and launch MitM attacks.
3. ARP Spoofing: An attacker can manipulate the Address Resolution Protocol (ARP) to redirect traffic through their device, allowing them to intercept and modify data.
